derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from Latin depilatorius, from depilat- 'stripped of hair', from the verb depilare (see depilate)

entry.def: Depilatory substances and processes remove unwanted hair from your body.
A depilatory is a depilatory substance.

means.word_mean: 1. a chemical (usually a sulfide) used to remove hair or wool or bristles from hides
2. a cosmetic for temporary removal of undesired hair
1. able to remove hair or render hairless
